title: Motorola MA1 for Android Auto Wireless Review: The ‘easy’ way isn’t always best
content:
Wireless Android Auto has been around for quite a while now, but for ages, it felt like something that only a brand new car would solve. That all changed with the arrival of wireless Android Auto dongles, and the dongle was pitched as the “easy” version, with a dead-simple experience and direct backing from Google. After a few months of use, though, I’m not so convinced MA1 is the best option.

description: The Motorola MA1 dongle promises to deliver wireless Android Auto, and it does, but bugs paired with no future support isn't a great formula.
